message.content:
cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DB, cs.SE, cs.WEB. 

The paper proposes a framework for verifying and validating semantically annotated data extracted from websites. This involves checking the syntactic correctness and completeness of the annotations against a vocabulary and domain specifications, as well as ensuring compliance with domain-specific constraints. The validation mechanism detects errors and inconsistencies between the annotations and the content of the web pages. This work involves aspects of artificial intelligence (AI) in terms of semantic annotation, information retrieval (IR) in terms of extracting data from websites, and database (DB) and software engineering (SE) in terms of developing a framework for verification and validation. Additionally, the focus on web annotations suggests a connection to web science (WEB).
